entries.meaning: (UK, regional) A nightjar, especially Caprimulgus europaeus (Eurasian nightjar). [from 17th c.]
(US) A New World nightjar of the genus Chordeiles, especially Chordeiles minor. [from 18th c.]
examples: The swallows circled around and I watched them and the night-hawks flying above the roofs and drank the Cinzano.

entries.meaning: A person whose preference or custom is to remain awake and active during the night and the early morning hours. [from 19th c.]
A nighthawker (metal detectorist who works illegally at night).
